definitions.definition: trade, especially between countries; the buying and selling of goods and services

examples.text: Leaders of industry and commerce met at the summit in Paris.
She has little experience of the world of commerce.
The marketplace was where commerce was traditionally carried on.
The marketplace was where merchants engaged in commerce.
the development of commerce with Asia

wordOrigin: mid 16th cent. originally in the sense of social interaction between people: from French, or from Latin commercium ‘trade, trading’, from com- ‘together’ + mercium (from merx, merc- ‘merchandise’).
